meanings.definition: Capable of being taxed or subject to duty.
meanings.sent1: The excisable goods were marked with a special label for taxation purposes.
meanings.sent2: The excisable items at the store had additional charges due to taxes.
meanings.sent3: The excisable chocolate bars seemed to have a hidden tax surprise inside.
meanings.sent4: Her excisable income felt like it was slowly disappearing under the weight of taxes.
meanings.sent5: The excisable property was a constant reminder of the financial obligations.

meanings.sent1: The excisable products had a higher price due to the added tax.
meanings.sent2: Excisable items often have a specific tax rate applied to them.
meanings.sent3: She jokingly called her excisable snacks 'taxable treats'.
meanings.sent4: The excisable goods were like little tax magnets, attracting fees.
meanings.sent5: The excisable purchases always came with an extra cost for taxes.

meanings.definition: Able to be removed or cut out.
meanings.sent1: The excisable section of the document was easily detachable.
meanings.sent2: The excisable part of the fabric could be snipped off if needed.
meanings.sent3: He carefully excised the excisable portion of the paper with precision.
meanings.sent4: The excisable piece of the puzzle was cleanly separated from the rest.
meanings.sent5: The excisable sticker peeled off effortlessly, leaving no residue behind.
